title: Ficino's Neoplatonic Sources: Plotinus to Proclus
description: The ancient Neoplatonic texts that Marsilio Ficino translated and that shaped Renaissance philosophy: Plotinus's Enneads, Proclus's Platonic Theology, Iamblichus's theurgy, and Pseudo-Dionysius's mystical theology.

books.title: Six Books on Theology of Plato
books.author: Proclus (trans. Taylor)

keyTexts: Plotinus Enneads: The One, emanation, return to source - foundation of Neoplatonism
Iamblichus De Mysteriis: Theurgic philosophy, ritual as path to the divine
Proclus Platonic Theology: Systematic Neoplatonic metaphysics
Pseudo-Dionysius: Celestial hierarchies, negative theology, Christian Neoplatonism
researchValue: Ficino's translations of these texts sparked the Neoplatonic revival in Renaissance Florence. Essential for understanding the philosophical foundations of Renaissance magic, Kabbalah, and Hermetic philosophy.
